channel.title: Allstar Fans
channel.description: Quick question, don't put TOO much thought into it, but for all you oldschool junkies that still like to play allstar servers from time to time..is there any content at all that would make you join that allstar or to continue playing it? Again, don't put too much thought into it lol..

item.title: Allstar Fans
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

Togasa:

I don’t fully agree with you clawz… besides the majority of users on here are just noobs who are straight from RS and want to make their own Leeched RSPS with pikachus and the same customs as every other leeched PI…who post 5-10 server help threads a day…and that’s all they do.

that’s somewhat true although at the same time they probably don’t care about the future of this community or rsps in general, they just want to have fun/make money and we were all ‘noobs’ at one point so meh

[quote=“Togasa, post:23, topic:539303”]Then there’s people like you, me, and so many others that are here to really help everyone else and to advance our knowledge of RSPS…we’re outnumbered by the sheer amount of ungrateful kids who just use this forum to get answers out of us.
Btw, check mopars stats…we haven’t ‘advanced’ in anything for years now.[/quote]
Yeah a lot of people are ungrateful and are basically just depending on us to write code for them because they want to make money

and I wasn’t referring to mopar, but rsps as a whole lol we aren’t going anywhere things have been pretty much the same for a few years now and it only seems to be getting worse with the recent explosion of people exploiting rsps just to make money

Read full topic

item.title: Allstar Fans
item.dc:creator: @Togasa Togasa
item.description:
@Togasa wrote:

Clawz fury:

yeah they were but people still using them need to move on imo, only way we’re going to advance as a community

I don’t fully agree with you clawz… besides the majority of users on here are just noobs who are straight from RS and want to make their own Leeched RSPS with pikachus and the same customs as every other leeched PI…who post 5-10 server help threads a day…and that’s all they do.

Then there’s people like you, me, and so many others that are here to really help everyone else and to advance our knowledge of RSPS…we’re outnumbered by the sheer amount of ungrateful kids who just use this forum to get answers out of us.
Btw, check mopars stats…we haven’t ‘advanced’ in anything for years now.

Read full topic

item.title: Allstar Fans
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

yeah they were but people still using them need to move on imo, only way we’re going to advance as a community

Read full topic

item.title: Allstar Fans
item.dc:creator: @Qu11 Qu
item.description:
@Qu11 wrote:

They were awesome when they first came out. AllStar was super fun, but mainly because you could do whatever the hell you wanted exploit wise.

Read full topic

item.title: Allstar Fans
item.dc:creator: @Encryption Encryption
item.description:
@Encryption wrote:

I enjoyed them in the early days, but to be honest they’re not all that interesting, but if somebody managed to clean and package it nicely I’d have hope again for those using it.

Read full topic

item.title: Allstar Fans
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

I don’t understand what you mean by the source has potential. Stability has always been a key role, whatever content gets added is up to the capability of the developer.

A cool feature I always wanted to see a server have is make use of the Java Skype API. It would be so cool being to to stream calls etc., using the game client itself

Read full topic

item.title: Allstar Fans
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

it would be fun to play for a few hours.

i’d probably never log in again after that

Read full topic

item.title: Allstar Fans
item.dc:creator: @Togasa Togasa
item.description:
@Togasa wrote:

[quote=“zuppers, post:16, topic:539303”]You’re not going to find any reputable allstar fans here, the source is literal garbage. You’re better off downloading something else and working on adding content similar to allstar.

Edit: I’ll go ahead and leave this open for discussion however I don’t want to see anymore flame over the fact that op is using this source, everyone has told him he’s better off doing something else.[/quote]
Sorry, didn’t know you had to be a ‘reputable’ fan (whatever that means) to give feedback on what you like about the source

Read full topic

item.title: Allstar Fans
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

pretty sure people only played all-star due to the fast leveling and amount of exploits available. don’t think you’ll ever find long-term players for it.

Read full topic

item.title: Allstar Fans
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

the changes needed to reflect a stable, scalable model would require a complete overhaul of the ‘allstar’ code base resulting in a code base resembling nothing of the original and making use of next to no code from the original.

Read full topic

item.title: Allstar Fans
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[code]
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

public class Fors
{
private static byte[] list = new byte[1000000000];
private static long startTime;
private static long endTime;
private static int counter = 1;
@SuppressWarnings(“unused”)
public static void main(String[] args)
{

System.out.println("LIST TEST");
  //for (int k = 0; k < 10; k++) {
//append();
//System.out.println("== Set:"+k+" Values:"+(1000000*k));
    //Type 1
    startTime = System.nanoTime();
    for(int i : list)
    {
        ;;;
    }
    endTime = System.nanoTime();
    System.out.println("For each loop :: " + (endTime - startTime) + " ns");

    //Type 2
    startTime = System.nanoTime();
    for(int j = 0; j < list.length ; j++)
    {
        byte b = list[j];
    }
    endTime = System.nanoTime();
    System.out.println("Using collection.length :: " + (endTime - startTime) + " ns");

    //Type 3
    startTime = System.nanoTime();
    int size = list.length;
    for(int j = 0; j < size ; j++)
    {
        byte b = list[j];
    }
    endTime = System.nanoTime();
    System.out.println("Using [int size = list.length; int j = 0; j < size ; j++] :: " + (endTime - startTime) + " ns");

    //Type 4
    startTime = System.nanoTime();
    for(int j = list.length; j > size ; j--)
    {
        byte b = list[j];
    }
    endTime = System.nanoTime();
    System.out.println("Using [int j = list.length; j > size ; j--] :: " + (endTime - startTime) + " ns");
 // }

}
}[/code]
since you askes

Read full topic

item.title: Allstar Fans
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“matzie, post:7, topic:539303”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=658138.msg4402514#msg4402514 date=1390979232]

nope, they were fun at the time but now that I’ve developed my own servers and I’ve grown up a bit I can’t see myself ever wanting to play those again

Yeah you say that now, until my allstar is released.

allstar has about a max player base of 20. So popularity cannot be the motive. There is a lot of potential behind it, if almost everything is changed. But i would do it with that source, because it is the only one i FULLY understand. If you changed the base, it is no longer an “allstar”. Not to mention, alot of the IP-banning features are very poorly done. I would like to see it for admins that you can ban a person that logged in after you. Unlike old allstars very simple fix… Also, for most of your for loops in the main class, use an iterated loop, rather than the the conventional for loop (Client c : players) rather than for( …;…;…), it has better performance(every bit helps for oldschool styles).

If you like i can make you a huge list of things that need to change in an alstar. I also have the HolyPkerz source. I don’t know if Rage still hosts or not. if he doesn’t i will release it, with permission. Dupes fixed, new mini’s, I was working on fixing nulling, but i learned how after he stopped hosting

Pretty sure the compiler converts for-each loops into for-index loops, you’re gaining no performance.
[/quote]
It has the potential to increase performance.

Code:

in this example the list.length must be retrieved every time. Where as in

It only retrieves the length of list once, then iterates through every value in the list, until terminated in one way or another.

[code]
C:\Users\Brockgame\Desktop\programs\Network>java Fors
LIST TEST
For each loop :: 6548361 ns
Using collection.length :: 8778215 ns
Using [int size = list.length; int j = 0; j < size ; j++] :: 538 ns
Using [int j = list.length; j > size ; j–] :: 269 ns

C:\Users\Brockgame\Desktop\programs\Network>java Fors
LIST TEST
For each loop :: 9565602 ns
Using collection.length :: 12963065 ns
Using [int size = list.length; int j = 0; j < size ; j++] :: 270 ns
Using [int j = list.length; j > size ; j–] :: 0 ns

C:\Users\Brockgame\Desktop\programs\Network>java Fors
LIST TEST
For each loop :: 6708156 ns
Using collection.length :: 8578539 ns
Using [int size = list.length; int j = 0; j < size ; j++] :: 0 ns
Using [int j = list.length; j > size ; j–] :: 0 ns

C:\Users\Brockgame\Desktop\programs\Network>java Fors
LIST TEST
For each loop :: 6632165 ns
Using collection.length :: 8793306 ns
Using [int size = list.length; int j = 0; j < size ; j++] :: 0 ns
Using [int j = list.length; j > size ; j–] :: 0 ns

C:\Users\Brockgame\Desktop\programs\Network>java Fors
LIST TEST
For each loop :: 9461858 ns
Using collection.length :: 13673116 ns
Using [int size = list.length; int j = 0; j < size ; j++] :: 269 ns
Using [int j = list.length; j > size ; j–] :: 0 ns

C:\Users\Brockgame\Desktop\programs\Network>java Fors
LIST TEST
For each loop :: 6792499 ns
Using collection.length :: 8963610 ns
Using [int size = list.length; int j = 0; j < size ; j++] :: 0 ns
Using [int j = list.length; j > size ; j–] :: 0 ns

C:\Users\Brockgame\Desktop\programs\Network>java Fors
LIST TEST
For each loop :: 12159779 ns
Using collection.length :: 16880602 ns
Using [int size = list.length; int j = 0; j < size ; j++] :: 539 ns
Using [int j = list.length; j > size ; j–] :: 269 ns

C:\Users\Brockgame\Desktop\programs\Network>[/code]
yes i stole the code to run the test from anther source, but i changed it to nano seconds to watch closer variance, and changed Integer to byte. and made the list an array(private server relevance) but in every one the for each comes out less.
1000 ns = 1 ms (correct me if im wrong)[/quote]

code for testing? also test a micro-optimized loop.

Read full topic

item.title: Allstar Fans
item.dc:creator: @Togasa Togasa
item.description:
@Togasa wrote:

[quote=“matzie, post:4, topic:539303”][quote author=Togasa link=topic=658138.msg4402241#msg4402241 date=1390927585]

nope, they were fun at the time but now that I’ve developed my own servers and I’ve grown up a bit I can’t see myself ever wanting to play those again

Yeah you say that now, until my allstar is released.
[/quote]
allstar has about a max player base of 20. So popularity cannot be the motive. There is a lot of potential behind it, if almost everything is changed. But i would do it with that source, because it is the only one i FULLY understand. If you changed the base, it is no longer an “allstar”. Not to mention, alot of the IP-banning features are very poorly done. I would like to see it for admins that you can ban a person that logged in after you. Unlike old allstars very simple fix… Also, for most of your for loops in the main class, use an iterated loop, rather than the the conventional for loop (Client c : players) rather than for( …;…;…), it has better performance(every bit helps for oldschool styles).

If you like i can make you a huge list of things that need to change in an alstar. I also have the HolyPkerz source. I don’t know if Rage still hosts or not. if he doesn’t i will release it, with permission. Dupes fixed, new mini’s, I was working on fixing nulling, but i learned how after he stopped hosting ;)[/quote]
I’d like a list, even though I was aware of the ones you just said.

Read full topic
